source.749c66e3:
# Getting data afterward 1980
data = data.loc[lambda data : data['year'] >= 1980]

plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
sns.countplot(x='year', data=data)
source.f9c34e5c: *The data looks so cleaned now. Let's do some analysis.*
source.c824c529: *Cylinders feature is not showing much variation in its median range.*
source.84017c98: *Almost 84% of cars uses gas as fuel.*
source.d23ba1e0: *As we can see diesel fuel-type has the highest median value out of all fuel-types showing distinctive range.*
source.6c677677: *White is the most preferred paint color.*
source.7fca6099: *4 wheel-drive is the most preferred drive out of all drives.*
source.f23cf061: *Cars having Automatic and manual gear have almost same price(median).*
source.fd2de419: *87% of used cars have automatic transmission system installed.*
source.9e3abd3b: *Ford is the largest manufacturer of cars followed by chevrolet and toyota.*
source.8a95b419: *Most no. of cars were manufactured in 2017.*
source.836e4aa3: *Most of the cars are in either excellent or good condition.*
source.507f6119: *Looks like the median price is around 10,000*
source.c2fac15e: *There are so many columns and some of them are unnecessary; so we will drop them.*
source.8a33f65b: *As depicted, we can see that ferrari has a much high median price followed by aston-martin and tesla(all re well-known brands for their engine and safety features)*
source.882d8a0d: *As we know, a customer is much likely to buy a car which has just set its tyres out of the showroom, so it's price is likely to be higher than others. No doubt here !!*
